Key Match Events: Kyle Hendricks showed he still has something left with a vintage quality start
Michael Busch blasted two home runs
Pre-Game Insights: Cubs manager Craig Counsell said the team's playoff odds had dropped to 0 percent
The Cubs avoided the sweep with a 6-2 victory
Post-Match Reflections: Cubs second baseman Nico Hoerner said the group has been pretty resilient
Cubs pitcher Jameson Taillon said the team will come in tomorrow and keep their heads down and go to work
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Cubs' ownership group and business executives must be wondering why the Brewers still controlled the National League Central even with their small-market payroll
The Cubs have to hope that patience, a sense of purpose and calmness will pay off in the future
Others: The Cubs' remaining schedule is relatively easy, but they can't make up ground with head-to-head competition against those wild-card contenders
The Cubs could finish the season with a 13-0 run and still miss the playoffs if the New York Mets go 8-5 down the stretch
